message.content:
We start by looking for any chain that makes Scott either an ancestor (or descendant) of Terry, or shows they share a common ancestor or descendant.

• One useful fact is that “Scott is Michael’s descendant” (so Michael is an ancestor of Scott) and “Rebecca is Michael’s ancestor” (so the chain upward from Scott is, for example, Rebecca → … → Michael → Scott).

• On the other hand, we have “Martha is Terry’s ancestor.” We also see “Martha is Denise’s descendant” and “Virginia is Denise’s ancestor” so Terry’s ancestor chain goes something like Virginia → Denise → Martha → Terry.

Now, if Scott were an ancestor or descendant of Terry, you’d expect a connection along one chain that “bridges” the two lineages. However, no rule connects Rebecca (or Michael) with Virginia (or Denise/Martha). Likewise there is no statement tying any person from Scott’s “branch” to anyone from Terry’s “branch.”

One might ask whether Scott and Terry have a common ancestor. (That is, do they both descend from some person?) There is no information – at least among the given relationships – that joins these two groups anywhere.

Thus there is no available evidence that Scott is Terry’s descendant, or Terry’s descendant of Scott, or that they share a common descendant or ancestor. The final answer is that none of the listed answer choices is correct.

<ANSWER>5</ANSWER>
